      • login

        @Path(value="/login")
 @POST
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public org.json.simple.JSONObject login(@FormParam(value="email")
                                                                                                             java.lang.String email,
                                                                                                             @FormParam(value="password")
                                                                                                             java.lang.String password)
        Parameters:
        email -
        password -
        Returns:
        Success Response : { response: { data: [2] 0: { firstName: "abc" lastName: "xyz" address: "indore" gender: "f" dob: 59266531800000 contact: "8871786146" id: 1 email: "xyz@newput.com" doj: 1439317800000 }- 1: { token: "ACBDE3A9C9956DD10BD3A5BC6C4DF017" }- - success: true rcode: null error: null }- }

        here token is the session token. Fail Response :{ response: { data: [1] 0: { msg: null }- - success: false rcode: "505" error: "invalid user" }- }

        it get failed when either user is not registered or either email id or password is wrong.
